item.title: Coronavirus: UK must find 'new normal' to ease lockdown - Raab
item.description: It comes as Prime Minister Boris Johnson arrives back in Downing Street to resume work on Monday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Furloughed workers urged to become fruit pickers
item.description: Environment Secretary George Eustice urges staff on furlough to ease a growing crisis on farms.

item.title: Coronavirus: Military tests key workers in mobile units
item.description: The mobile units travel to "hard to reach" areas as the government looks to ramp up testing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson's return to work 'a boost for the country'
item.description: Boris Johnson is "raring to go" as he returns to resume official duties in No 10, his deputy says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Athlete's cancer treatment hopes dashed due to lockdown
item.description: Sarah Wright was accepted on to a drug trial in the US but cannot fly due to coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Coronavirus: Spain records lowest daily death toll as lockdown eases
item.description: Health chiefs say 288 more people have died as children are allowed out for the first time in weeks.

item.title: Trump faces scrutiny over West Point address plans
item.description: The president is scheduled to give the commencement address at the US military academy in June.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Myth' that Sweden has not taken 'serious steps'
item.description: Sweden's deputy prime minister, Isabella Lovin, told the BBC's Andrew Marr that measures that were too harsh could not be sustained over time.

item.title: Birmingham's Nightingale hospital 'has no patients'
item.description: Birmingham's NHS Nightingale hospital was opened by Prince William on 16 April.

item.title: Coronavirus: French police seize 140,000 black market masks
item.description: Officers caught a businessman unloading the masks from a lorry into a house in St Denis near Paris.

item.title: Coronavirus: Chelsea Flower Show moves online for first time
item.description: Virtual tours, gardening demonstrations and special shows will take place during week-along event.

item.title: Coronavirus: High Street shops preparing ways to reopen
item.description: The British Retail Consortium has issued post-lockdown guidance for non-essential retailers.

item.title: Tom Brady gets apology for park removal
item.description: The mayor of Tampa hints she is open to renaming the Tampa Bay area as she writes a witty apology to Tom Brady after he is thrown out of a city park.

item.title: Sally Rooney's novel Normal People adapted for TV
item.description: On location in Dublin with the stars of Normal People Paul Mescal and Daisy Edgar-Jones.

item.title: Coronavirus: Artist Tom Croft paints NHS key worker portraits for free
item.description: Artist Tom Croft has introduced 500 artists to possible subjects, after an online post offering to paint the portrait of a front-line worker.

item.title: The farmers bringing their fields indoors
item.description: Indoor farms, where crops are grown on shelves, are supplying cities with fruit and veg.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can these robot roommates liven up lockdown?
item.description: The BBC's Cody Godwin invites some robots to entertain her - and her dog Bogart - during lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is a vaccine and how is one made?
item.description: We look at the work needed to create a vaccine and when one might be ready for the coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dorset celebrant hosts handfastings online
item.description: A celebrant is hosting a virtual commitment ceremony for couples on their wedding days.

item.title: Eurovision Again: Why fans of the song contest get together every Saturday
item.description: Fans of the song contest are re-watching old competitions as "a distraction from all the bad stuff".

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Homeless' struggle to social distance
item.description: People living in shared accommodation are concerned about how they stay safe.

item.title: Week in pictures: 18-24 April 2020
item.description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

item.title: Ultra-Orthodox and trans: 'I prayed to God to make me a girl'
item.description: Growing up as a Hasidic Jew, Abby Stein had no idea trans people existed - she just felt sure she was a girl.

item.title: Coronavirus: Spain's children run free from lockdown - but not all
item.description: After six weeks indoors, under-14s are being let out of doors, but how damaging was the lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: A couple inseparable in sickness and in health
item.description: Michael and Mary Blessington were placed apart in hospital, but started to improve once moved together.

item.title: Cornelius Lysaght: My 10 top racing moments from 30 years at the BBC
item.description: Racing correspondent Cornelius Lysaght reflects on his favourite moments from nearly 30 years as he leaves the BBC.

item.title: Charli XCX on her lockdown album: 'Why didn't I do this before?'
item.description: The pop star has set herself the challenge of recording a new album from scratch in six weeks.

item.title: Coronavirus: How nature is reacting to the lockdown
item.description: There has been a drop in pollution levels right across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Coronavirus: Five firms booming despite the lockdown
item.description: Amid all the threats posed by Covid-19 pandemic, some firms are finding ways to forge ahead.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are these seven targets being hit?
item.description: Ministers have set targets for testing, medical equipment and hospital beds. Have they delivered?

item.title: Coronavirus: The celebrity cash giveaway and other stories fact-checked
item.description: Unpicking the week's dubious claims including a fake cash giveaway and a Covid-19 "remedy".

item.title: Coronavirus: Has Sweden got its science right?
item.description: The strategy devised by scientists was to keep large parts of society open but not everyone is convinced.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should I worry about my lockdown eating?
item.description: Weeks of lockdown is putting a strain on some people's relationship with food.

item.title: Who is the greatest post-war British manager? Analysis and vote
item.description: BBC Sport's chief football writer has made a shortlist of the greatest post-war British managers, now it's turn to vote for the best.

item.title: Moise Kean: Everton 'appalled' at 'lockdown breach' incident
item.description: Everton say they are "appalled" after images emerge appearing to show striker Moise Kean at a house party.

item.title: I believe Premier League season will be completed - Jota
item.description: Wolves and Portugal forward Diogo Jota believes the Premier League will be completed despite the cancellation of some other European leagues because of coronavirus.

item.title: Gossip: Liverpool's no to Coutinho return
item.description: Philippe Coutinho is turned down by Liverpool and Arsenal pull out of contract talks with Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.

item.title: Rangers to produce evidence 'well in advance' of SPFL general meeting
item.description: Rangers say they will produce evidence supporting their push for an independent investigation of the SPFL "well in advance of a general meeting".

item.title: 'I was just lost. I was confused & overthinking' - Gauff, Medvedev and other tennis players open up
item.description: From winning the SW19 junior title to almost quitting tennis, Noah Rubin knows the mental stresses on players and is now giving them a platform to open up.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should we all be wearing face masks now?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus: How close is the UK to 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are international comparisons difficult?
item.description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Everybody should be avoiding non-essential contact, and you should stay at home wherever possible.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: The world in lockdown in maps and charts
item.description: With more than a million coronavirus cases confirmed worldwide, an analysis of the world in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What do all the terms mean?
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak

item.title: What is the coronavirus?
item.description: Everything you need to know about the coronavirus â€“ explained in just one minute.

item.title: Coronavirus death rate: What are the chances of dying?
item.description: The current best guess of a 1% death rate does not apply to everyone.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will the outbreak end and life get back to normal?
item.description: The huge challenge the world faces to find an exit strategy to end the lockdowns and return to normal.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'How I'm coping with self-isolation'
item.description: With the impact that coronavirus is having on our daily lives, people are finding new ways to fill their free time.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I'm begging you, please be careful'
item.description: A woman being treated for coronavirus has made an appeal for people to stay home.

item.title: Coronavirus update: Why does staying at home help?
item.description: After Boris Johnson brings in new measures, the BBC explains why staying in is a matter of life and death.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to wash your hands - in 20 seconds
item.description: Dr Adele McCormick from the University of Westminster demonstrates how to wash your hands.

item.title: Coronavirus information: What should I do?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is among those to be treated in hospital for the symptoms of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: More myths to ignore
item.description: Reality Check tackles misleading health advice being shared online.

item.title: The workers braving coronavirus
item.description: From supermarkets to warehouses to pharmacies, these are the people keeping things running.

item.title: The volunteer army helping self-isolating neighbours
item.description: The coronavirus outbreak has left many feeling trapped indoors, but for some help may not be far away.

item.title: Coronavirus: The rough sleepers who can't self-isolate
item.description: With soup kitchens closing and hostels 'like a Petri dish', homeless people are scared about the future.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I never thought I'd be so proud to sell bread and butter'
item.description: Laura McLellan felt humbled when she and her team of checkout operators were told they were key workers.

item.title: 'Nobody told us about the coronavirus pandemic'
item.description: Before setting sail around the world, Elena and Ryan told their families not to give them bad news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protecting the 'one in a million' girl
item.description: Bex Price's family went into isolation early as coronavirus would almost certainly kill her.

item.title: Coronavirus: Making face masks feels 'like the war effort'
item.description: Thousands of people are producing cloth masks, despite UK authorities saying they are unnecessary.

item.title: Coronavirus journey: The 'last cruise ship on Earth' finally comes home
item.description: From political storms to presidential pleas, it has been quite a journey for the MSC Magnifica.

item.title: The tiny premature baby who fought off coronavirus
item.description: Peyton Maguire from Lanarkshire is one of the youngest Covid-19 patients in the UK.

item.title: How Typhoid Mary left a trail of scandal and death
item.description: The chilling story of an Irish immigrant cook who brought typhoid to well-to-do families in New York.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grandmas' top tips to get through lockdown
item.description: We've asked Grannies from around the world for their advice on staying positive.

item.title: A coronavirus survivor's story: 'I touched death'
item.description: Elizabeth says she feels lucky to be alive after falling seriously ill with the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wacky and wonderful scrubs for NHS workers
item.description: Hundreds of volunteers are making scrubs of all different designs and colours for doctors and nurses.

item.title: Owen Harding: The teen who disappeared during lockdown
item.description: The story of the 16-year-old who went missing, and the community who tried to find him.

item.title: Eliud Kipchoge: The humble home life in rural Kenya behind remarkable athletic success
item.description: Witnessing Eliud Kipchoge's humble home life in rural Kenya sheds light on some of the secrets behind his remarkable athletic success.

item.title: Afghanistan: The detention centre for teenage Taliban members
item.description: The Afghan detention centre houses some 300 boys under 18, of whom half are alleged to be militants.
